data.formatted_address: 61 Hai Tháng Tư, Vĩnh Phước, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Ponagar Temple

reviews.text:
It’s a small temple, you can easily walk around it casually in around 30-40 minutes,
You pay for you tickets at the left of the entry gate ( 30000 VND) they give you a plastic card you insert it into the slot at the turnstiles and in you go. The are some stairs to negotiate to get to the temples but not a lot,it can get very crowded early in the morning 8-9am as this is when all the tour buses pull in, even on weekdays. They will lend you free of charge a gown to cover your legs / shoulders to enter the main temple if you happen to get Randomly picked for not wearing the appropriate clothes, I was picked for wearing shorts ( so l wore a gown) but I witnessed many others just going inside the main temple just wearing tang tops and shorts
( I was wearing a collared shirt and knee length shorts) yes u can walk to this site from downtown takes around 30 minutes
Great place to visit. Plan for 2 hrs, ticket can be purchased outside at the office. There were quite a few tourists so it can take a bit to wait to take pics.

Brought my kids here on a sunny afternoon. Good place for some culture and education. Try to go on a weekday afternoon where there are not heaps of tourists. Praying inside the temple is available but will need to borrow a skirt. The structures and artwork of the aboriginals were beautiful. We spent a good 2 hours there. Affordable tickets as well.
When in Nha Trang be sure to visit the Ponagar Temple. Ancient structures that make beautiful pictures. The grounds are also well maintained.

Great historical site and worth visiting.

I walked from the Novotel at 6am and arrived around 6.30am which is the best time to visit. I was the only person there apart from the staff who were working.

You can wonder around for an hour or so and there are tables and chairs to sit under the trees to enjoy the view.

The entrance fee was minimal, 20,000vnd. There is information about the history of the site in the museum.

A wonderful site to visit, there are also many cafes around for a cool drink before the walk back.

Highly recommended for everyone

There are steps however nothing onerous or difficult.

data.formatted_address: Trần Phú Quảng trường, Hai tháng Tư, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Tháp Trầm Hương

reviews.text: Pretty lively around the area. It seems like people just hang around, swims, eat and enjoying their time there. Iconic meeting spot. There was Heineken event when I was there so it's pretty hyped up. The vibe around the area is good. You can choose to party or relax.
Amazing architecture. Beautiful Beach. Awake City making sports AND exercises Even 5am. Something i really love in this city.

Great attraction is just symbolic but it is a beautiful building at light there’s lights inside and birds. There’s a lot of life going around full of people and kids, the building is iconic in Nha Trang and is located right in front of the beach. Great for kids around specially on the weekend they have little cars full of lights and roller shoes for kids to have fun also they have the paper birds to play with the wind. There is a great vibe around as well on the other side of the road there’s the Nha Trang Night Market full of things to buy from food to snacks, clothes, accessories and more… Quite pleasant to go around and it symbolises the city centre.
Beach side is gorgeous. On weekdays is not crowded at all.
Good open spot. Nice to take wide video of the beach. Not as crowded as other spots

data.formatted_address: Unnamed Road, 7574+H85, Vĩnh Thạnh, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Mộ Bình Tây Đại Tướng Trịnh Phong

reviews.text: A historical place in Nha Trang.
Solemn and clean

data.formatted_address: Đảo Hòn Tre, Vĩnh Nguyên, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: VinWonders Nha Trang

reviews.text: Well worth the money! We spent two full days here and only just got around to most things - we missed the zip line. Recommend you get here early for this as it can be a two hour wait as they only take 10 up every half hour. Most rides had no wait or very minimal. Staff are friendly and safe. Lots of options for every age group! Lots of walking around! It’s essentially a theme park, water park, beach, zoo, bird park, aquarium in one! With so much else included. A fun gondola ride and shows!

Amazing they built this huge complex on an island. One day is not enough to see it all (especially with kids). We spent all day in the water slides area. I wish we stayed on the island for a night or two. Tickets may seem expensive at first, but almost everything is included. Food prices are reasonable. The daily 15 min water fountain show is very good. The aquarium is amazing.

Operators, please change music in the Faris wheel. It's a bit loud and not that pleasent.

We went there today. Amazing place. I recommend it to everyone. It's too big to see all in one day but you certainly get value for money. I recommend you to register for an account with vinpearl and then book your tickets 7 days in advance for the best discounts. But check in advance of that because they do offer further discounts some days. Combo tickets also work out cheaper. We got an $83 combo ticket for $65 with a food discount as well. The architecture of the buildings in the harbour is unreal.

Could be great, but everything is crazy slow.
The whole theme park has so much potential, offering so many different activities, but most of the attractions are so inefficient.
Staff aren't trained to make things fast, so even though there are only 10 people in front of you it may take up to an hour for a waterslide or an arcade game, because the whole system is so inefficient.
Because the park is so big, none of the things are really special nor efficient, so you spend lots of time waiting for the staff to prepare the activity. I regret spending so much money to come, if they trained the staff to be faster it would be such a great day trip.
What a shame

A very impressive theme park. Exceeded my expectations. My kids absolutely loved it. It has something for everyone. A water park that extends into the sea, rollercoasters, all kinds of rides for all ages, castles, animal park, plants area, a huge ferries wheel, anything you could ever wish for in a theme park.

The whole park was very clean. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Food choices are very good.

data.formatted_address: 668R+W2G, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Tata Aventure

reviews.text: Kids love there !!!
great show for the kids :D like a magic place!!!
A place worth visiting for children's dreams

Spectacular, great sound and light!

High resolution projection technology, giving magical, sparkling images to every corner. The sound & light system covers every square meter of the large square, bringing realistic, extremely vivid emotions.

Playing the role of "backbone" connecting the story, the masterpiece of sound combined with 3D mapping effects, choreography and actors brings the audience into the mind, flying to the top with a magical journey in the Tata Show.

Tata Show Vinpearl Nha Trang is creative and friendly to most audiences, especially families and children. The story brings new images and contains many meanings. It is the struggle between good and evil, the victory of truth, goodness, and beauty crowned by the courage deep within each person.

In particular, the Tata Show does not use language but uses the effects of music, lights and actions to tell its own, world-class story performed by the Vietnamese team. Therefore, the product can be for all ages, all nationalities, without any language restrictions.

The 2 main dancers danced really well, very very beautifully. I saw them sweating more than bathing, breathing heavily because they were very tired but still very enthusiastic in interacting with the audience. It's great!

The only minus point in my opinion is that although the cast is large, compared to the large and majestic stage. If you can fix this, 10 dong no buts ❤️
Watching Harry Rabbit go missing was fun, but the wait was a bit long. The soundtrack was very good and the sound was great

data.formatted_address: 65HX+WP7, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Dong Park

reviews.text:
The park is located at Nha Trang beach. There are many trees planted inside, but they are not beautiful.
It is often used to organize events. Inside the park there is a stage with a roof.
No need to buy tickets.
The public toilet area is hard to find. The park does not have amusement parks.
This is a mid sized park by the beach and it’s nice to walk around.
Nice park close to the beach. Not too much to see here but it's a pretty cute place for walking
gorgeous beach, clear sea, affordable umbrellas, price 50 dong
Great

data.formatted_address: 08 Trường Sơn, Vĩnh Hoà, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 57129, Vietnam
data.name: Làng Nghề Trường Sơn - Trường Sơn Craft Village

reviews.text: This is an amazing place. You can see how the local people create the most beautiful arts and crafts by hand. They are very talented, they work hard, and their items are just totally amazing. I wish I had 1% of the talent they do. You can also purchase many of the items you see them make. A well worth it and must see thing to do if you are in Nha Trang.

Large grounds, lots of traditional crafts, live traditional music performance, amazing gardens.

This place does not get the tourists it deserves, which is good if you don't like crowds.

There are lots of shade but no air-conditioned spaces, so plan accordingly.

The guided tour in English was very appreciated.

Nice place to visit
They have good gifts for purchase such as bamboo cups, reasonable price, better than airport or in the city
However less creative items. We got guided by Ms Dung , such a kind person to show us around and help us with photos
There is music show at 1pm everyday
Ticket about 80k per person

We stumbled upon this place. You buy a ticket and get a guide included. We were showed around the whole place, it was filled with artists and craftsman/craftswoman doing there thing and it was amazing to watch them just mid process. You can talk to them and ask them questions and you could buy some of the items. One of my favorite thing there was the gourds, they have a whole process where they plant, harvest, age, cure and decorate the gourds. There was a big chandelier type thing made with gourds with poems written in all of them, gorgeous.

This doesn't seem to be on the map for tours. Maybe we just got lucky. Thoroughly enjoyed all thandcrafted items and watching the Craftsman at their work. Also enjoyed the call and dance entertainment. Very photogenic area with beautiful artwork and landscape.

data.formatted_address: Đảo Hòn Tre, Vĩnh Nguyên, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Robinson Beach Nha Trang

reviews.text: This place is not overly crowded. There's kayak and lots of chairs on the beach for usage. Good place to relax and chill

Small stretch of beach. Water a bit cloudy. Only for swimming.
FOC locker with deposit of VND50,000.
Theres kayak activity available with a charge
Tents available on the beach for sun bathing
It seems to be a resort full of rich seafood, delicious coffee and enough to satisfy the traveler.
Fantastic experience and very well organised tour. The team was perfect from start to finish. Well recommended!
Nice landscape, plenty of fish to see by snorkeling, but limited access only within the bay

data.formatted_address: Lương Sơn, Vĩnh Lương, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Monkey Island tourist resort

reviews.text: We went in April, I wouldn't suggest to go there in this month🤣 It was unbearably hot and we were tired easily because of this and couldn't enjoy fully. So choose a nice weather to go there. Didn't see many monkeys though maybe because we didn't bring food 😕 I was more scared than excited 😆 cuz I'm afraid of animals but at the end I got used to them haha. There are many nice locations like a swing, flowers, photo zones and beach OH and there was a monkey show which included monkey races as well. We kinda enjoyed this trip. And the way to the island 🏝 is pretty 😍
I was so so on this place but my wife loved it. There are tons of monkeys and they are freely around. There are also lots of photo op places and the monkeys put on a show which was good.

Nice experience. A great place to visit. The monkeys are friendly, so no danger. Tickets can be purchased online or on-site, with no price difference. It takes approximately 10-15 minutes to reach the island by a standard boat.

I would like to say if you go monkey island, go in weekdays.. peaceful, beautiful, all Good.  There are few activity which is happening when you request to them like bike racing, swimming race, and Few more show by Monkeys are ok ok type....So  go for Nature view not for monkey...

It was nice. It had many monkeys that are not scared of people and the boat ride there is nice. Be sure to go there during monkey show times which were 10am and 2pm local time. If you did not manage to catch the time for this, then there isnt much to do there. We tried the F1 racing there as well but it was in relatively poor condition and was very hard to use, which ruined the fun. If not for the monkeys, there would be no other reason to visit this island. But be careful with what you bring. Food or drinks will make monkeys aggressive towards you and snatch them from you. This couple that followed us brought bananas to the island to feed the monkeys but when they arrived, a monkey snatched them all and tried to harrass them for more. The good thing is that we didnt have to wait for the boat for too long. Personally I would not visit again but it is a tourist site so it may be attractive for most people.

data.formatted_address: Số 1, Cầu Đá, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Bảo Tàng Hải Dương Học

reviews.text: Large marine life + history museum. History part is entirely about maps and Vietnamese exploration of the disputed Spratly/Paracel islands. Also has a very large range of marine specimens and a well-maintained aquarium. Amazing to see such a comprehensive exhibition in a small city.

Its edutainment with ticket of 30,000 VND, worth money with live exhibition : first encounter is whale shark skeletons then outdoor display about mangroves with real saltwater croc. , then exhibition glass box of sea lifes:shrimp, colorful ddepp ocean fish, moray eels, etc. then further to sea tortoises well . Walkinh through tranparent glass tunnel to watch shark, manta rays , stingrays etc. Finally, the tour ends at buidings , exhibiting marine life , microalgae , planktons, etc: it allows 045 minute-1hour to stroll through .

A fine oceanographic museum. There are lots of fishes, few small sharks, few crocodiles and different aquatic animals. Apart from this, there is a beach nearby and various ship models and methods of catching fishes. All in all, few hours well spent. Recommended.

The only reason I am giving this place four stars is because there was no crocodile, but try your luck and who knows, it might be there! This was a lovely, calming visit where we got to see a diversity of sea animals, including some straight-up MONSTERS caught decades ago! Check it out if you’re looking for a simple thing to do in between your other activities in Nha Trang. The whole experience was lovely, except for the fact I couldn’t see a crocodile

40k VND adult ticket . Your impression will depend on your previous experiences. For the city of this size this is really good achivement to have a museum like this. If you seen some wellknown worldvide oceanariums (like one on Phu Quoc )this one not a match in terms of general public amusement. A strong point is for marine life specialist or student a whole hall of all kind of local species in jars. Most of exposition is available on wheelchair. Maybe except saltwater crocs.

data.formatted_address: Vĩnh Nguyên, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Bai Tranh Beach

reviews.text:
Honestly a beautiful beach with some fun activities,  but the boats are just too close to shore and it makes everything just reek of diesel. Doesn't help that smoking is allowed so it really just smells like cancer everywhere.

On another hand though, I had a grand time taking pictures of an adorable golden tree snake.

I was the only western woman there, felt safe. Very small restricted area for swimming. Floating garbage, smoking everywhere, gasoline smell from the boats, not enough seating. Lower your expectations; so cramped, and the boats never stop coming. I was there for 2 hours, nothing to see. Sand and rock beach access. Would be a beautiful little beach, but it’s very exploited for tourism.

Bai Tranh Beach is known for its tranquil atmosphere, white sandy shores, and clear waters. Visitors often appreciate the serene surroundings and the opportunity to relax away from busier tourist areas. It's a good choice for those seeking a quieter beach experience with beautiful natural scenery.

Nice beach with plenty of activities to do with extra fees. We did jetski, it goes very fast and the thrill was worth it!
You get to the island by boat and there’s everything needed to enjoy a few hours there, lounge chairs, snacks and drinks. Be aware that it’s a remote island so some of the ameneties are limited but overall good experience

Our visit to Bai Tranh Beach at the end of the year was a delightful surprise. Despite the slightly dim and rainy weather, the beach retained its allure, presenting a spectacular view of the island's shoreline. The atmosphere, though a bit dark, added a unique charm to the beach, creating an intimate and serene setting.

For those contemplating diving, the dim lighting underwater might limit visibility, but it introduces an intriguing and cool aspect to the experience. While the underwater world may not be as vivid, the mystique of diving in such conditions provides a different, captivating perspective.

In essence, Bai Tranh Beach proved to be a resilient beauty even in less-than-ideal weather, offering a unique and memorable experience, especially for those seeking a distinctive diving adventure.

data.formatted_address: Vĩnh Phước, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Hon Chong

reviews.text: First time visiting Hon Chong. Has to be one of the highlights of my trip such a beautiful and serene place. I highly recommend visiting this place if you haven’t already. There is also a restaurant you can eat at as well that overlooks the water.
Beautiful and calm spot to enjoy the ocean. The place is pretty small, but you do have some nice views over the ocean and Nha Trang.

It's a tourist trap. We came here because of bouldering. However, climbing is not allowed. Entrance is VND30k per person. Do not come if you are a climber or an outdoor adventure type of person. It's no big deal to see some rocks and take pictures.

A very unique landscape with some pretty views. If you have the time to visit, it’s worth it! You will need to pay a 30,000VND entrance fee, but that’s very affordable and it’s worth it. I recommend visiting at sunset if you can!

The only real downside are the other tourists. Depending on when you visit, it can be very busy and loud.

Also, once the sun goes down you will be kicked out, so don’t expect to stay too long after sunset.
A beautiful and peaceful place that you can spend for one whole afternoon there.

data.formatted_address: 76Q4+88H, Phạm Văn Đồng, Ba Làng, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Beach Nha Trang

reviews.text: Not a bad spot but nothing is around really tho.

Safe and sound

Thank you for watching my review
And have a lovely day guy's 😊
Beach is very clean and beautiful.
I like this place
The beach is beautiful, the waves are light, the sand has trash but not much, there are no peddlers or solicitation of services or purchases, very ok

data.formatted_address: 438 Ngô Đến, Ngọc Hiệp, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: THAP BA MUD BATH

reviews.text: An excellent experience overall, though the mud bath felt a bit rushed. We visited with our three children, and even the youngest ones enjoyed it. After the treatment, we felt deeply relaxed. For the best experience, arrive early in the morning before the tourist buses come. After the mineral baths, you can linger in the swimming pools and at the lovely pond for as long as you like during operating hours. Highly recommended as a unique and enjoyable experience.

The facility is really huge, it’s like garden of Eden, feeling is warm when you enter the reception, staff give you their service menu,
You Pay & they give you ticket.

First stop is the locker area, staff will give you water , towels ans locker ans they will get your ticket.

Staff will guide you the mud bathe (20mins)
Then to Jacuzzi pool 15mins , and to hot bathe (35degrees) , u have the option for herbal bathe for a different package , what we avail is 315 dong For mud bathe + jacuzzi + hot bathe and usage of the pool facility.

The pool area is huge too , so many place to choose from , there is a big pool with hot water (35-40degrees)

And another area with cold pool and cold jacuzzi.

There is also kiddie pool, what I love most is the hot spring waterfall, it’s like water massage.water flowing to these facilities are coming from the hot spring so it’s really good for your body and mind.

I got hungry so we tried their restaurant , its more sort of like a canteen, price are a bit expensive and taste is just so so , if your not too hungry maybe better eat outside.

But overall this place meets our expectation

To be honest I felt so sleepy and lazy after awhile , this a really nice place to relax , we came in during the weekend so locals &  tourist are there but still plenty of areas where u can relax, reclining chairs are everywhere.

I didn’t give 5 star because staff needs improvement of their english skill for non locals, and  also there should be english translation on most signages or infos.

When we first showed up I felt deceived, we were walked to a space that is described in a lot of the other one star ratings. I proceeded to let them know this is not what I was sold based off of the imagery in their website, the booking portal isn't very clear in what it is that you're purchasing due to language barriers and how it differs, we showed them a picture of what we thought we were getting and it is a new facility up the mountain, completely private spaces, where they have to shuttle you. It may feel infuriating at first that there is an upcharge, BUT I PROMISE YOU IT IS ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT. it's not an experience to pass up. It's beyond luxury with nature the service time and entire peace it bring. DONT RUIN IT WITH KIDS PLEASE. there should be an age restriction to maintain the serenity.

The lady at the reception is not really polite, making the start of the experience a bit off.
Mud bath is ok - although it's written everywhere that there should be some time under the sun to absorb the nutrients, and you don't get this time you go from bath to bath.
Swimming pool is very clean, although no one really goes in as it's boiling hot. Really missing a cold bath after spending a long time in hot water already.

Front desk weren’t that friendly and told me no information of where to go. I hired a swimsuit and towel and eventually found the baths. I was in there for a while then told to lay in the sun after. I showered then again had to ask what I do now as no one told we what to do. I was pointed toward a hot tub which had algae around the edges. Then moved to another pool where a bucket of orange substance was thrown in, I was not
told what this was either. Whilst in the pool the staff were hosing down the floor next to me making my shoes and phone wet and spraying in my face. Overall not a great experience would be much better if the staff gave more information and were a friendlier.

data.formatted_address: 34 Tô Hiến Thành, Tân Lập, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 65000, Vietnam
data.name: YOLO Hopping Tour - Ocean Camp

reviews.text: Me and my friend had a blast at the YOLO hopping tour. The tour guides are amazing, energetic and always happy to help you if you need anything. We went snorkeling, enjoyed live music, and hung out on the tubes/paddle boat. They even had a water slide. The food was surprisingly tasty, healthy and authentic. It came out pretty fast despite having a bunch of different tour groups come for lunch on the island at the same time. Well done Yolo tour, cam on for your hospitality 😊

The best boat trip ever. The staff were the most considerate and attentive to everyone’s needs. Snorkling was fantastic and saw masses of tropical fish. Got to jump or dive off the roof of the boat. Then went to another spot where the cocktail party in the sea was great fun. The lunch was lovely and authentic. We paid extra for jetski and was also great. I’m getting on and have been on loads of trips but this was number one.
it was fantastic, staff were great and they know how to party~!~! I would recommend for people who would like to scuba dive and snorkling. very nice time.

My group of 9 had a blast on this tour. I have been to Nha trang and joined other island tours previously and wanted something different with less focus on island hopping vs more fun. The group we shared our boat with was with a large group of Koreans and two from UK with our group of 9 from
Canada. The group bonded so well largely due to the fun we had. Great entertainment, great service and a great mix of a group!
I had a blast on this tour! You get to do tons of activities with it being priced very reasonable!

data.formatted_address: 24/19A Nguyễn Thiện Thuật, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 68000, Vietnam
data.name: Nha Trang Fun Divers

reviews.text:
I did 2 fun dives with this dive center. We communicated through whatsapp, and all my questions were answered promptly.

Pick-up 7am at my hotel was on time. Everything was well planned and organized. The boat was shared with other divers, snorkelers & free divers. It didn't feel crowded at all. Lunch was also served on the boat. Returned to my hotel at 1:30pm. Everything is good.

We had an amazing time diving with Nha Trang Fun Divers. The boat was well-equipped and comfortable, and the service was great. We highly recommend for any anyone looking for a great diving experience, especially for divers who enjoy macro videography and photography, and those who are interested in spotting small creatures like nudibranch, leaf fish, frogfish, and many more!
The instructors were knowledgeable, friendly, and made us feel safe throughout the whole experience.
Thanks to our dive guide Quyen and dive center manager Andre for your friendly, caring services.
See you next time!

Andrey organised everything perfectly. Everything was on time, without hustle. I did 2 dives with Quyen. He is a real professional, takes care about everything in the water and on the boat. I really enjoyed my birthday during this diving trip. Also the food on the boat was delicious.

I completed my advanced open water course with Nha Trang Fun Divers. It was an incredible experience and I would highly recommend!! Both my instructors were super supportive, helpful and lovely. The boat team are all professional and helpful. They also provided lush vegetarian food for me. I had the best time!

I organized the dive trip with Andre two days in advance, which worked out flawlessly.
The trip was well organized and I felt safe throughout the trip.
On the boat, our guide introduced us to the dive spots and prepared the gear for us.
Once we returned to the harbour we were reliably dropped of back in Nha Trang.
Andre was easily reachable via WhatsApp and answered questions quickly, which was amazing.
Overall just a great experience.

data.formatted_address: Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Nha Trang

data.formatted_address: Vịnh, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Lặn Biển LabiXa

reviews.text:
Despite encountering less-than-ideal weather conditions due to a storm, the diving experience at this coral-rich location was still decent. The staff at the diving center provided clear advice and guidance, ensuring that the impact of the weather on visibility was well communicated.

While the underwater clarity might not have been optimal, the professionalism and transparency of the staff helped manage expectations, eliminating any potential issues. Overall, despite the weather challenges, the diving experience was positive, highlighting the resilience of the dive center in adapting to unforeseen conditions.

Amazing and surreal experiences. The instructors are experience and well -training.
Photos and videos are too good that could make your friend really jealous. Approximately 50usd for one person.
Professional instructors, amazing scenes underwater
We. Love
Nice

data.formatted_address: 735 Nguyễn Tất Thành, Phước Đồng, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Hon Mun Marine Protected Area

reviews.text: We visited with a your .they provided snorkels and masks.. so many fish Bao our guide was so funny and got us there early which was great as we had the bay to ourselves.

Amazing opportunity to see beautiful underwater life. We used True Friends Easy Riders to schedule an amazing snorkel tour to see all sorts of beautiful scenery and creatures. Be aware, you will feel a bit like a cattle heard, but it's worth it.
A pretty nice snorkelling place. There are lots of corals and tropical fishes. Our boat got threre in 1 hour after departure. We hopped two places around Hon Mun island. It was an amazing adventure!
Lots of corals, lots of small fishes. But the area need more serious protection. Fishing boats still lurking around, marine park guards not doing their job properly.
Went here with the dive centre. Really nice place! Amazing corals. Not so many fish. I heard there is a lot of fishing going on around this place which is a shame.

data.formatted_address: Phước Trung, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: The Fairy Forest

reviews.text:
A beautiful area with several ponds where you can feed the fish. There are goats, rabbits, guinea pigs, peacocks, and a goose. Carrots for feeding the animals are provided for free. There is a small café where you can buy drinks and sit in the shade. There are many photo spots.

Cons: There is ongoing construction as the place is being expanded and improved. While walking around, you can see and hear the workers, and there was a paint smell from something being painted nearby.

Overall, it's an excellent place, especially for visiting with children, for a few hours.

The entrance fee was 50,000 VND.

Note: you have to pay an entrance fee of 50k vnd to visit this place. It was worth the price.

A very secluded place, even the local people don't know about this place, so when I visited it was very quite with only a few people.
The place is quite spacious, with various scenes of forest, lake, hill and stream. And an animal farm with a few cute rabbits, goats, sheeps, chickens and a dwarf horse. You can feed the animal if you want, the staff will give you the food to do so. There's also a pond with very beautiful koi carps, again, the staff will give you some fish food to feed them.

There's a house to rest and a coffee shop inside, you can buy drinks and take a nap on the available lazy chairs. And the 2 girls serving at the coffee shop are actually angels, they are so cute and friendly, oh... I wish I could see them again.
The science garden is very beautiful, with many places to take photos and many trees that provide cooling. The owner is very friendly. She is enthusiastic and kind. It is worth sightseeing.

A very beautiful and aesthetically pleasing place! This place is filled with creativity and soulful energy. All locations are thought out to the smallest detail. Favorite photos from this place will be very beautiful

The author of this park is a very nice person. You can see her works in the park. The artist has made every effort

Also you can buy a book with her creative food photo works! These photos could decorate modern exhibitions. I wish good luck to the author!

I apologize for my English. And thank you for the wonderful gifts and emotions! Prosperity to your park!

Nha Trang is well known for its beaches and scuba diving and has developed into a popular destination for international tourists, attracting large numbers of backpackers, as well as more affluent travelers on the south-east Asia circuit; it is already very popular with Vietnamese tourists, with Nha Trang Bay widely considered as among the world's most beautiful bays.[citation needed] Tourists are welcomed to participate in the Sea Festival, held biennially. Nha Trang was the site of the Miss Universe 2008 Pageant on July 14, 2008 and Miss Earth 2010 was held on December 4, 2010. It was also the site for the April 14, 2015 season 8 finale of Face Off. Nha Trang has been approved to host the 2016 Asian Beach Games.

Historically, the city was known as Kautharaunder the Champa. The city is still home to the famous Po Nagar Tower built by the Champa. Being a coastal city, Nha Trang is a centre for marine science based at the Nha Trang Oceanography Institute. The Hon Munmarine protected area is one of four first marine protected areas in the world admitted by the IUCN.
Source: wikipendia

reviews.text: The place is just small but full of antiques and fascinating artifacts. Went there on a Monday (it is closed on weekends), there was no one inside nor in the lobby. Not sure if we had to buy tickets since there was no one there. It only took  us less than 15 minutes to see everything inside. Some taxi drivers don’t know this place, we ended up being taken to Yersin street instead and had to pull up my Waze for the driver to find this. It’s inside a compound of a hospital just across from the beach. It’s educational although most writings are in French.

Recommend this museum for tourists especially young people. This museum is the small building that is located in Pasteur Institute Nha trang. Ticket price is cheap 20k. I learn many things from his life, live and work constantly, patiently, sacrificially with and for his passion for science, discovering and traveling.

This museum is a truly unexpected and rare find.

I came away with more questions than answers about a hero and polymath that I had never heard about. Alexandre Yersins' contributions to mankind across several disciplines (medicine, botany, optics), you will quickly discover, are astonishingly significant to us all and our ways of life.

Like Dr. Whos' Tardis, this intimately small space is bigger on the inside than out and packs a punch. You will leave a better and wiser person, more grateful and appreciative of life's heroes and their colonial endeavor to make the world a better place.

It doesn’t have too many historical antique pieces inside but it was still very interesting to learn new stuff about incredible person, who gave to that world much more then famous people do today.

I can advise it to everyone who loves history.

Ticket: 20,000 VND
Open weekdays 7:30am to 11:30am and 2pm to 5pm.
Very informative museum on Yersin as well as the pest. He was a very well-rounded individual with a passion for science. A kind of Renaissance man, his story and belongings reflect that.

It was so interesting to see the scientific technology used during his time. There is some reading to do, but it is translated in Viet, French, and English. The museum was established with the help of the Pasteur museum in France, so the main information panels are in French, with their translations a little to the side.

It's a bit outdated but so well worth it if you like history and/or science. I hope to see this museum expand and give us more information on his discoveries. Maybe even add a video to address how he came about it and the research he established with his peers, as well as the repercussions it had.

reviews.text: It is very good location and nice hiking and swimming spot! Please note that it might be challenging for small kids and senior people. Wear sport shoes and clothes and take a bottle of water to stay hydrated 🤍 also I recommend to plan more time for swimming in the lake #2 since it is very nice spot and the water is very comfortable temperature

The basic ticket to walk to the waterfalls seems a bit much (135k), but it's worth it. The place is beautiful and clean, you can easily spend half a day here chilling or playing in the lakes.

The trail is short but very fun once you get to the river as it involves some scrambling over the boulders. I arrived around 9am on Sunday and there were barely any people there. Lake no. 2 was the busiest as that's where you can cliff jump. That's where most people seem to stop, too. Lake no. 3 and beyond were very peaceful. There's another lake just behind the "Don't go further" sign near lake no. 3. I had that lake just to myself the whole morning, other people started showing up only around noon.

Showers are available near the entrance. The ticket includes a small bottle of water.

Brought my wife and 2 kids there. (12yrs and 5 yrs) We arrived a 9am and stayed u til noon. It was a 10-12min walk inside the paved trails to the stream. From there we hiked up to both Lake number 1 and 2. Lake number 2 had the most shaded and rest areas. Parts of the climb was steep and needed some attention but my 5 yr old was a trooper. The lake area as great! Went for a swim and had little fishies nipping at your feet and body. Really well maintained and clean. Beautiful place. Great value at only 135k per person. My daughter got in free because she was below the height limit.

Definitely worth a visit. We took a taxi to the venue and the driver waited until we were done. There weren't very many people, nice and quiet and beautiful nature. We didn't eat on site and the pool wasn't worth much, but the waterfall was and the walk itself was very beautiful. Good for medium-sized children. In the water there are small fish that nibble on the skin, which tickle quite a bit.

What a great day! This place is gorgeous and serene. The climbing adventure to get to the top fall was not for the faint at heart but once you get to the top you’re so happy you did it. The water is amazing and the little fish eating off the dead skin cells almost tickle you. We were all laughing. You shouldn’t miss this incredible place!

reviews.text:

Located in the middle of the wilderness with narrow paths that are difficult to access, overlooking the low grass and many dogs of local people's houses.

The back door is quite desolate. It is a dead-end gate of Dien Khanh ancient citadel.

According to the Center for Management of Monuments and Scenic Landscapes of Khanh Hoa Province, Dien Khanh ancient citadel was built in 1793. Few people know that Dien Khanh ancient citadel used to be the political and administrative center of Khanh Hoa province through the ages. historical period from 1802 to 1945.

Historical documents have recorded the process of formation and construction of this citadel. In the year of Quy Suu (1793), after defeating the Tay Son army and capturing Dien Khanh palace, Lord Nguyen Anh carefully studied the terrain of this land and built Dien Khanh citadel with an area of ​​about 36,000 m2. The citadel was built according to Vauban-style military architecture - a popular military citadel model in Western Europe in the 17th and 18th centuries. The wall is hexagonal in shape but the edges are uneven, creating protruding corners to make it easier to see both sides. Inside each corner is a large area of ​​land used as a military shelter. Each corner of the citadel is built with a mound about 2 meters high to place cannons, called a corner fortress. The wall is made of soil about 3.5 m high, with a moat 3 - 5 m deep and 20 - 30 m wide. Initially, the city opened 6 doors, but later removed 2 doors.

reviews.text:
In Vietnam there is a Mr. Binh San. a man with a vision and mission. the cordiality, passion for nature is unprecedented. the love for nature too. It is beautiful how being one with nature is, away from all luxury, away from all stress and being lived. come to yourself for a moment, in short, back to your own self.

thank you Mr Binh San

You are not allowed to go to the top of Hon Ba nor Yersin’s house on your own, but instead have to buy a ticket for 300.000 vnd from the Kong Forest place and its car will take you up.
This is ridiculous as one, the Hon Ba Nature Reserve should be a public place, and two, i don’t play any of the games in Kong, why paying that much.

An amazing ride to go to the top. Nature is everywhere: pure water spring, beautiful trees and plants, the roads is very quiet and fresh. You can easily stop near the stream "suoi dau" to swim and make bbq for the lunch (don't forget your trash plz...).

As previously said the place has been closed for years. There is locked a boom gate after kong park. They really should have a sign on Google Maps and at the entry. River is pretty but there is garbage all along the way which is pretty depressing to see.
Natural untouched beauty, rent a motorbike and drive through the mountains, beautiful river and untouched forest.

data.formatted_address: Hòn Tre, Vĩnh Nguyên, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Vinpearl Zoo

reviews.text: It is a small zoo. Perfect for family or a casual visit. Ideal for a quick escape into nature and some great animal shots!
Small zoo here. I love flamingo at the front. Good to take some photos.

Massive variety of wild animals however the rhino & hippo largest animals in the zoo have such small spaces. No way doesn’t recreate the space they have in the wild. Amazing to see them but sad to see them living in such small enclosures. Along with the lions & tigers who also have tiny enclosures. Watching the bear pace his enclosure.

Wow... This is better than many of the zoo I have ever been to. Here you can see Lions, Monkeys, Giraffes, flamingos, rhinos, and so many more animals!!! The way they are displayed are very well and you can really get close to them. This can be a nice zoo by itself, but surprisingly this is just a part of Vinpearl Land.

Vinpearl Zoo is great for families with children. There are many types of animals here, well cared for and fed, so looking at the animals is very comfortable. Dedicated staff guides, you should bring an umbrella on sunny days.

data.formatted_address: Đường Phan Bội Châu, Xương Huân, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Dam Market

reviews.text: Large market complex. The round building is primarily for tourists, selling counterfeit clothes and souvenirs. Adjacent square building is more local, selling dried produce (nuts, seafood, beans, rice etc) but is still spacious and clean. Nothing like the roadside wet markets elsewhere in Vietnam. Prices at the local side are fair- good place to pick up dried fruits to bring home

Authentic Vietnamese market, fresh produce of all kinds,dried goods, meats etc, worth a walk through, not to far from the beach so when you’re had enough you can go for a swim afterwards. Plenty of cafes, food stalls all around the surrounding area.

What am amazing place. We would have gotten lost if not for a woman that apparently works for all the merchants. She spoke English well and led us through the amazingly large muddle  of small entrepreneurial shops. She helped us to bargain with the very merchants that support her. I imagine you can but just about anything here.

Took grab here , there’s lots of section for souvenirs , dry food , household , clothes , shoes etc . It’s a must bargain here (50percent till 70 percent ) , mostly tourist shop here and the Vietnamese told me it’s expensive for them to shop here , I got a dress for 150kVNd , seller initial price was 350kVnd , bought some Vietnamese snacks nearby this market .

Very disappointing. Low quality merchandise other than for the fresh food vendors. If you’re going to shop for tourist merchandise, cheap clothing or fashion accessories there’s nothing here not available elsewhere. Here, due to bus loads of foreign tourists arriving the vendors are very aggressive and unfortunately the premises is very badly run down, poorly ventilated and not very interesting at all. There are other much better markets in town with equally good or better prices.

data.formatted_address: Hai Tháng Tư, Vĩnh Hải, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Vinh Hai Market

reviews.text: A fantastic market selling all kinds of fruit, vegetables, fish, meat, and some clothing and hardware. It's great to explore.

A busy local market with a little bit of everything. Fresh fruits and vegetables around the back and south side of the perimeter, eggs, meats and fish inside towards the back half. Also many fresh cut flowers. You can find everything you'd need to prepare a meal here. They also have prepared food stalls if you'd like to grab a bite while you shop. Clothes, jewelry, phone accessories, hardware, tools, the list goes on and on. Friendly, helpful and patient sellers. Geared more for locals, fair prices.

If you're a tourist and have never been to a SE Asian market, this would be a good one to experience, as it's not too overwhelming. Be mindful of motorbike traffic, as there is some inside the market itself, but especially outside as many residents shop without ever getting off their bikes. Enjoy!
This local market is so great! People here are very nice and patient. We ate noodles and pudding and brought some specialties here. The price was very fair.
Very active local market. This place has clothings, food, flowers, and you can pretty much find anything that a big local market usually has.
Very good market, cheap prices, fresh goods 👍

data.formatted_address: 47 Phương Sài, Phương sơn, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Phuong Sai market

reviews.text: Im not sure how this is rates above Dam market and night market if you are a tourist (which is why my review is in English!).  We walked here after seeing the long son pagoda  (few minutes walk) which you can walk to from the beachside hotel area.  The market itself is more like a long street and then some internal markets.  Whilst the street is longer, the covered market bits are smaller than xom moi and definitely smaller than dam market.  Mainly foods for locals (fresh products meats, vegetables), its interesting to look, at but not so much as a tourist to buy stuff.  They did have clothes and other bits, but not as much as the Dam market.  We saw a lot less tourists at this one compared to the others and I can understand why.
This is a street market where you see people selling fruits, vegetables, meats, and fish. If you live nearby here, it looks like they have good pricing.

Good ambience but market is just filled with peanuts sellers and ice cream vendors. All shops are selling exactly same souvenirs and restaurants are selling weird seafood. We dined at a place but honestly did not like the food at all. Ended up paying 1100K vnd for dinner for two. Ice cream we had with fresh coconut and mango was nice.
Nothing exciting happening here just ice cream and peanuts vendors pushing tourists to buy them. Bought a few pearl souvenirs but I don’t believe they’re real.
Ok
Enjoy 👍

data.formatted_address: 657W+RF5, Võ Thị Sáu Trường Sa, Phước Trung, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Binh Tan Market

reviews.text: This local market seems to have alot of seafood, and they look really fresh. However, the smell of this area is not so good because of that...

This is a small authentic market for finding fresh fruits, seafood, lights (can buy yellow bulbs, LEDs, lamps, etc), simple furniture, and clothes. Locals go here. There are better markets and better stores in Nha Trang, but i love this market, it's quaint.

Cheap food and drinks can be found here. Ordered Duck Rice which cost me RM6 per plate. Comes with free Vietnam icedtea. Wet market goods sold by the locals here. Restaurants starts to operate from 5pm onwards. Come here via scooter as easy to park.

This place smells to high heaven. However, the prices are the MOST competitive in Nha Trang, and all foods are well presented, fresh and the proprietors take care with presentation. Highly recommended!
The number one frome the all markets

data.formatted_address: Trần Phú, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Night Market

reviews.text:
[Visited january 2023]
The market is located right next to the beach, which is great. You can find anything from souvenirs to dried fruit, beachwear to jewellery. It’s mainly focused on tourists, in my opinion, but nevertheless a great place to shop around.

Small but still enjoyable night market. Indeed stays open until very late. The biggest draw is the proximity to the beach, and to the open areas nearby. Come during christmas or New year's for excellent vibes.

This is relatively smaller than other night markets in Vietnam but it's right near the beach. Expect the place to get really
crowded in the summer.

Nha Trang Night Market is where the local life comes alive with vibrant colors and unique aromas. It's evident that much of the merchandise here comes from Chinese factories, lending the market a distinctive aroma. Unfortunately, souvenir stalls disappoint with their lack of variety, offering mostly uniform items found throughout the market.

Nevertheless, this is the place to find the best dried mangoes and macadamia nuts. These treats stand out for their quality and flavor. It remains a mystery why no one has thought to sell shelled macadamia nuts, which would make them much easier to consume.

Visiting Nha Trang Night Market immerses you in the local atmosphere, rich with vivid colors and distinctive scents.

Pretty short and small night market that sells souvenirs from Vietnam , straw bags which made from China which I can buy online through Lazada or shopee or Tao bao lol 😂and cheaper from online (no need waste my time and breath for bargaining ) the only thing I bought was the Chou Chou peanuts from here

data.name: Chợ Đêm Nha Trang

reviews.text:
At Chợ Đêm Nha Trang, you found yourself enveloped in a vibrant tapestry of sights, sounds, and smells. As you navigated through the bustling market stalls, you were tantalized by the aroma of sizzling street food wafting through the air. The vendors greeted you with warm smiles, beckoning you to sample their culinary delights.

You savored the flavors of traditional Vietnamese dishes like phở, bánh xèo, and fresh seafood cooked right before your eyes. The cacophony of voices speaking in rapid-fire Vietnamese added to the market's lively atmosphere, immersing you in the local culture.

Amidst the hustle and bustle, you stumbled upon rows of stalls selling an array of handicrafts, clothing, and souvenirs. Making it an unforgettable experience at Chợ Đêm Nha Trang.
Night market with many vendors. The vibe of this market is not for me though.

Attention Korean people!!!!!!!

Please go here instead of going to the night market in Nha Trang city. Just cross the bridge and a more enjoyable world unfolds.

Actually, the reason Koreans go to Southeast Asian night markets is for food, snacks, and fun? The downtown night market that many Koreans go to doesn’t have that. This place is completely local, and it's clean. Of course the price is cheap!!!!

The portions aren't very large, so you can order a variety of items and receive a receipt, so it's a good idea to bring cash and enjoy delicious food and the local life. There are so many babies and puppies, so cute haha
Between 6 and 7 o'clock, locals with children come and have food and drinks, and there are a few Russians.

It's a night market built in a park, so come around 5:30 before sunset and take pictures. When the night market opens at 6, find a good spot to eat, drink beer and drinks, and when the DJ plays a song around 7:30, you can look around and take a Grab.

When I found a spot I liked, Mr. Wen came and I thought he was trying to solicit customers, so I was annoyed, but he was just a friendly person who took the drink order delivered and cleaned up the place. Sorry for being here ㅠㅠ
It seems like the seats are divided into sections, but you can order food from all over and eat it all in one place. Most people don't seem to understand English, but there is a Korean menu that is strangely translated through a translator. Everyone is friendly anyway, so you can order everything with a wave of your hand.

Recommended menu.
A store selling snail dishes. Flavored clams, conches, flower snails, and especially the Thai-style clam stew tastes 100% authentically Thai, making me wonder if it's Vietnam or Thailand. Good good. Feel free to order a variety of products.
Ban Xeo. I added all the pork belly, shrimp, bean sprouts, and squid and ate it with vegetables and sauce. I also farm rice noodles.
As for drinks, there are a lot of places that sell mojitos and they are perfect to eat with local food.

Night market but only selling fried fish balls, food, drinks, nothing special. No parking spots, parking far away costs 30-40k/car.
What tourist city prohibits stopping and parking 😑

Like a miniature food street, mostly snacks and selling toys for children
It seems like a new night market but there are quite a few kiosks that have already been closed
When I tried rice paper, the way it was made seemed to be aimed at foreign tourists, so the taste was very strange, especially with bell peppers, so the smell was very strange, depending on everyone's taste.
Prices are soft 20-30-40-....
There is the first pizza stall from the parking lot, priced at 60 for sausage + cheese, it's fine and has a lot of fillings. It's just that the crust isn't fully cooked yet, but the seller is very good and worth the experience.

data.formatted_address: 102b Trần Phú, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Best Western Premier Marvella Nha Trang Hotel

reviews.text:
The hotel is located at the edge of the main tourist area of Nha Trang. Modern hotel with nice and comfy rooms. Great view from rooms on hight floor. However, a few minus points bothered me very much:
1. The hotel has not enough elevators. During peak hours (especially morning or check out time) it take ages before you can go down or up.
2. The breakfast room is too small. During my stay you had difficulties to get a table
3. Some of the staff is not well trained and even not friendly or polite. In particular the guy at the egg station.
4. The reception should work more professional. I had to ask twice to get a correct receipt of my payment.

It is a newly built hotel and there is absolutely no complaints about the room nor the conditions. From the first moment stepping into the hotel and the room, It is spotless and the services rendered by the front desk is of the highest quality. I checked out today and I have to mention "Ngan"  at the reception for her help in carrying the bag outside to the minivan. She took the initiative without being asked and these little things are what makes BWP Marvella a good hotel.
The hotel was impeccably clean, the staff was friendly and attentive, and the amenities provided made for a truly luxurious
I feel relaxed here. The breakfast meal is very delicious. I will come back next time.
Without doubt the best hotel in Nha Trang!

data.formatted_address: 24 Tôn Đản, Phường Lộc Thọ, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Venue Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent location on the 2nd row to the beach. Night market and other shopping in the immediate vicinity. Great beach right across the street. Unbeatable price-quality ratio. The staff was very friendly and eager to fulfill our wishes. Many small restaurants right outside the door.

This was the first hotel in my month of travel where the WiFi was incredible. It worked smoothly and at good speed. This made me very happy. They also gave me a room upgrade. The reception staff are very polite. Cleaning is done every day, or rather they ask if the room needs cleaning

Cheap hotel for the quality provided. Even though it’s on a small street, cars can still get in and they arrange parking for free. With a reasonable price for two people, you get a bathtub, sea view, breakfast, a swimming pool, and parking. This price is hard to believe. Best wishes for the hotel s continued success. Hotel Nha Trang Khanh Hoa Vietnam

Hotel boutique sea view Very friendly and efficient young receptionist at reception upon arrival and departure. Called me around 10:00am to tell me I could enjoy my stay. bedroom. Great room. Very beautiful sea view from the 12th floor. Very efficient air conditioning. Very comfortable bed. There was a safe, which is a plus. Rather large swimming pool for a rooftop, with a beautiful view. Ideal location

At first we were put in a room on the 2nd floor, it was very bad. It was a bit cramped and the windows overlooked the bar, making it very difficult to sleep. After our request, we were moved to the 5th floor. The room was spacious, everything you needed was there. Cleaning was done every day, towels were also changed. Breakfast was average, not great, not bad. Great location.

data.formatted_address: 150 Dã Tượng, Vĩnh Hoà, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 57129, Vietnam
data.name: Sep'on Heartfulness Centre

reviews.text:
Summary: This is Bali meets Vietnam in a great way. Wifi works great if you just want to enjoy the vibe and sit in the relaxing cafe to work.

Location: This is not on the main strip of attractions in Nha Trang and if that's what you're looking for, this might not be the right spot. However, if you want a more authentic experience, or if you're going to the S. Part of Nha Trang for surfing, this will likely be a preferred spot.

Vibe: This is a place you go to recenter from the hustle and bustle. The calm, healing atmosphere is going to make you contemplative and meditative. The owner has thoughtfully constructed each part of the building to connect those enjoying the center back to the earth without trying to take you away from the fact you live on earth.

Staff: Very friendly. They have built this as a wellness center. They speak great English if you need this as I did.

Drinks: They use locally sourced Coffee from Da Lat and have their own cold brew blend which I quite loved.

Other:
There are a lot of activities and the list appears to be growing. The owner appears to have built this spot to encourage more spiritually oriented retreats, yoga, like Reiki Healing, Sound Bath and meditation. You can participate in these activities even if you are not staying at the guest house.
This place is perfect. Beautiful spaces. Short walk to the beach. They also make great coffee
Peaceful place, happy and nice staffs, room is very clean and comfortable. Highly recommend. I will come back.

1) very noisy, the room's soundproofing is extremely bad, anyone outside can hear everything. The car passed by and heard the loud sound of the car. There is a flat pillar in front of the balcony door, you can hear the sound of electricity running through it
2) If you leave earlier than 7am and return later than 11am, you have to call the staff to let them open the door, which is quite inconvenient (the staff's enthusiastic attitude is very loving).

Beautiful room, friendly to nature and environment, concept combining living environment and healing. Unique architecture and craftsmanship. Friendly staff and very fresh energy. Overall touching and complete

(oekoen was here 😃)

A well maintained and pretty spacious Park with nice trees, greeny areas and walking paths. The statue of Dr Yersin with a memorial table describing his life activities and how he was closed with Nha Trang. The Park is surrounded by sea in the North and East sides. From here we can see crossing next to Tran Phu bridge and Ponagar Tower in the North East direction.
Ok to stop by if you are seeking shade during the day. But nothing special here, not a tourist attraction.

Good walkable park with a statue of Alexandre Yersin.

According to Wikipedia, “Alexandre Emile Jean Yersin (22 September 1863 – 1 March 1943) was a dual national Swiss and French physician and bacteriologist. He is remembered as the co-discoverer of the bacillus responsible for the bubonic plague or pest, which was later named in his honour: Yersinia pestis. Another bacteriologist, the Japanese physician Kitasato Shibasaburō, is often credited with independently identifying the bacterium a few days earlier, but may have identified a different bacterium and not the pathogen-causing plague. Yersin also demonstrated for the first time that the same bacillus was present in the rodent as well as in the human disease, thus underlining the possible means of transmission.”
Nice peaceful park right in front of the beach in Nha Trang. Not many people there and I didn’t see any tourist. Good place to chill and relax

data.name: Phong Nha Botanic Garden

reviews.text:
Quite an enjoyable visit. Similar to another reviewer here I made the mistake of assuming this would be a traditional botanic garden (my bad there in not doing the due diligence).

Instead, it offers a forest or jungle walk experience which was quite nice albeit rather hot and humid (in April): The surroundings are beautiful, but it's important to note that the longer walk can be challenging if you’re not used to walking in humid weather. The view from the waterfall was quite picturesque and quite a few folks took a dip in the pool. The viewing point, however, may not offer as rewarding a view and can be difficult to access, making it less worthwhile.

Overall quite a decent place and well worth the visit

The Botanic Gardens, while enjoyable to visit, might not meet expectations as a traditional botanic garden. Instead, it offers a forest or jungle walk experience. The surroundings are beautiful, but it's important to note that the longer walk can be challenging. The view from the waterfall is picturesque, offering a glimpse into the jungle, but the viewing point may not offer as rewarding a view and can be difficult to access, making it less worthwhile. Personally, I found cycling around the area and exploring nature to be a more fulfilling experience, but this preference may vary from person to person.

This garden is lovely, it is more of a walk in the forest as opposed to a botanical garden in the UK. The trees, and other flora that you'll see are wonderful and it is cooler due to the foliage. The view point is nice, a little overgrown but you get an evening nicer one towards the end, spoilers in the pictures. We swam at the Gio falls as well and it was so cool and refreshing, exactly what was needed. We did the 1.5 hour route, but there is also a 0.5 hour and 3 hour route available.

TLDR: very nice walk - recommended, use proper shoes and take enough water and a little energy snack.
....
We cycled all the way from Phong nha to the botanic garden. We had very bad bikes but it was no problem at all. Mostly flat.

BUT: last 800 m are very steep. If you have no gears you need to walk and push.
Please be careful on way back down as these old bikes might not break well enough. Huge risk of crashing. Just walk down as we did.

At the garden bicycles park for free, scooter 5.000 and cars 10.000.

Entrance is 40.000 per person

There are various walks of 0.5 h to 3h.
We did the long walk and it took us 2h in total. So not the 3 h as advertised.

On the way you will find a couple of water holes where people apparently like to cool down.

We didn't but it looked safe. At the end of the walk there is a medium size waterfall with bathing option.

The walk (long one) starts uphill on a path with concrete steps. Easy enough for average fit people.
It is very beautiful and serene.

The last bit before the waterfall was very steep and a little slippery.
There are ropes to support you but a certain strength, agility and balance is needed.
Not recommended in sandals.

There is a little store for drinks/restaurant in front of the garden to charge your battery afterwards.

As a life long motorbike rider, I am always looking for really winding / challenging roads....well is the best I have ever been on. If you google map the surround roads here you will be thrilled but if you choose some longer journeys that will take hours make sure you have survival essentials like water, food, lighter to start fire, knife for defense against anything wild if you're broken down / flat tyre or stacked it no traffic passing no houses near by no ph reception so don't go it alone or without essentails, it is very rewarding ride with so many great pics

reviews.text: My impressive point when coming to this cactus garden is that there are many types of cacti, each type is arranged in several representative pots, which is very convenient for choosing and easier to compare between types. They were both friendly and enthusiastic in sharing their experiences in growing and caring for plants, helping me choose, and introducing me to the names of cacti and succulents as well as the meanings they bring. The impression on this garden is really great, in the future I will continue to support it!

The coffee and smoothies were delicious. Great .. please stop by the shop to enjoy drinks and check in right at the shop. You should schedule to spend a minimum of 90 minutes in this flower garden area to fully enjoy. There are so much to see here!!!
Many beautiful photo spots
Of several greenhouses and expositions at once, this one - Japanese themed - impressed the most. An extremely colorful place, very convenient for photo sessions, especially thematic ones.
Even if you are not a fan of cacti, this place is well worth seeing. It's like entering another world. Really fascinating that something like this exists in a theme park.

I don’t understand why people post photos that don’t correspond to this place? This is a pavilion where cacti, baobabs and other plants from the arid regions of the planet grow. What does this have to do with the flowers from the neighboring pavilion?

data.formatted_address: Botanic Garden Tambon Thung Khai, Amphoe Yan Ta Khao, Chang Wat Trang 92140, Thailand
data.name: Thung Khai Botanic Garden (also signed Peninsula Botanic Garden)

reviews.text:
Underrated attraction close to the city Trang. Our hike took 1.15 hours with a total of 3 kilometers. You will hike on the ground (easy good path through an amazing jungle) and in the air (a beautiful canopy trail). Free entry without a tipping option. You will have to register your name though at the entrance.

Recommended, especially when you are looking to have a peaceful and quiet time (we were the whole time alone). 😄

P.S. keep in mind that there is no Grab (drop on point is not supported in this area) on the way back to the city. Very weird, but we had to walk for a while.

Absolutely worth a visit if you like canopy and wetland walks.

The highlight is certainly the long canopy walk that is stretching over several towers and levels, some quite high up. There's also a nice walk on an elevated walkway through wetlands.

It takes about 1 hour to complete the 3km loop and although it's mostly in the shade it can get quite hot, bring plenty of water.
When we visited on a weekday there were only 3 other cars in the parking lot, we didn't see any other people but could hear some voices in the distance.

Entrance is free

Very unique setting to experience the different levels of a rainforest, without going far from the city. Watch your head climbing the stairs, but everything feels safe and secure. We saw dozens of butterflies too.

Very nice walk (3km) into the forest on a concrete pathway, all the time in the shade and a very nice part on the canopy walkway.
Free carpark and free entry. I did the walk at the end of the afternoon, nearly nobody, it was very quiet and relaxing.
The access to the canopy walkway is by the main entrance of the Botanic Garden. Beware, Google Maps sent me on a dust track in the forest, I had to go back to the main road.

If you're anywhere near Trang then you should visit this botanical gardens. It has a robust steel canopy walkway that is worth visiting. Entry is free and you can spend the whole day soaking in the positive vibes from the jungle.

reviews.text: We love this natural beach, less tourists, dark sand, some dangerous places for swim. However there is a rescue group there. Seafood is little higher price than Nha Trang city, but good quality, more tasty! Local people are kind and take care of their guest when we joined in the ocean if something happened they will tell the rescue group.

One of the best beach in Vietnam for swimming. But except some luxurious resorts, there are not many services for travelers nearby though.  I stayed in Cam Hai village, 2km away from the beach, and rented a bike to get to the beach.

Agree that Bai Dai Nha Trang is a bit of a tourist trap in that the seafood is a bit more expensive than in Nha Trang, but the beach is relatively clean and the water is much nicer than the strip in Nha Trang. The sand is clean and powdery, not filled with coral and stone like the central Nha Trang beaches. Beautiful views and very relaxing!

Beautiful quite beach 45’ away from Nha Trang , closed to Cam Ranh airport. Perfect place to go swimming with clean, shallow white sand beach, away from noisy places. My favorite place in Nha Trang to relax:)
This place has great potential to be the next Bali or Phuket beach!

reviews.text: Great vibe, we came in at night there was a live dj and the music it was good. The drinks as well were very good and at great prices, they should add beer 0.0% without alcohol to their menu as could be any pregnant woman that still likes beer… The outside area has a great vibe and we really enjoyed this bit in here. I would like to add that their toilets are public at the beach but if the customers are using these should be a bit more cleaned idk they are filthy and smell really bad.

Visited this place to chill and I must say this place didn't disappoint me. It's definitely a place to hang-out with friends as it's on the beach. Their drinks are superb and affordable, and their choice of music was exceptional. Their staff were very attentive and the service was fast. I will surely visit this place when I return to Nha Trang. Totally recommended!

Nice beach bar to chill out, watch the ocean, and have a drink with friends or maybe a date! 🙃 Beach vendors walking by selling food, like lobster. Bar itself has a decent selection of beverages, a cool design, staff are friendly, they play good music and prices are okay in regards to the supreme location! ☺️👌

Unfortunately, I can’t really say this place was good. We requested the “Shrimp rolls” but later learned they were “pork rolls” with a shrimp tail sticking out for looks and deception. Very disappointed especially since we do not eat pork. Beware if you have dietary restrictions I would not recommend going here.
This bar is located at the beach with many orange bean bags. It’s comfy and nice to spend some time. The music is a bit too loud if you wanna have a conversation here.

data.formatted_address: 78-80 Trần Phú, Lộc Thọ, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Vinpearl Beachfront Nha Trang

reviews.text: Great hotel located right across the road from the beach. Great for those looking for a place to relax and get in some beach time. The hotel itself is a good standard 4 star hotel. The lobby is spacious and luxurious. My room was excellent, with a balcony to enjoy my ocean view. The bathroom size was just right. It has a kitchenette, space for a small table and chairs and a work desk. The bed was extremely comfortable. I had an issue with housekeeping not cleaning up the rubbish from the previous guest, but when I complained to the front desk they immediately fixed it and were very apologetic for the mistake. I had a fruit platter sent up as an addition to the apology. I like the customer service focus this hotel has. I made use of the hotel's gym and pool, which were both great. The best aspect about this place was its own deckchairs on the beach. The boys at the beach are great at looking after your things, getting you fresh beach towels and chairs as required.

Room is spacious but the standing shower is not the same case. Housekeeping needs some improvement. The spa and their therapists are super! Highly recommend the spa. Elevator sign should be on every floor, not only public area floors though.

Hands down the best hotel I've stayed at. The view from the room was beautiful. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet and room service food was delicious. Stay was affordable and exceeded expectations. Will definitely be staying here again next time I visit.

The spa at the hotel is quite serene. You are noticed and immediately welcomed before evening stepping foot into the facility. Cold lemon tea is served complimentary while you review and select from the myriad of services being offered. The prices are a bit pricier than what you would find outside the hotel but it is still definitely a great steal. Stop by and try it, it’s a worth a shot.

Family of four just stayed five nights in the two bedroom ocean view balcony room. We were very impressed with clean and spacious rooms. Staff were excellent and the buffet breakfast is the best breakfast we have ever had in all the countries we have visited. Location is the best, right across the beach. Thank you for a wonderful stay and we will come back soon! (Don’t be afraid to cross the street with so many mopeds and cars on the road. Everyone shares the road so walk slowly, be visible and stay together to walk across to the beach. For practice, play and master the Frogger game before coming to Vietnam!)

reviews.text: Great location near the city. Functional train station with nothing much special. There is a stall selling some snacks and a coffee shop in the building. So make sure you stock up on anything you need before you come here. Staff at the information counter is helpful. Nothing fancy, just functional.

They tried to rob us immediately as we arrived, opening a backpack while we were busy looking for our driver under the rain. Immediate bad impression but a stark reminder that Vietnamese are commonly thieves and opportunists. Trains are always very late, they are dirty, smelly and loud, especially since these Vietnamese don't know the concept of talking normally. And since they never leave it in their pants, every family has many kinds with them, who keep running, jumping and eating.
The train line itself was fine and comfortable, but I ended up booking a 8hrs ride going backwards because the website showed the wrong image.
The station is quite bad, a small waiting room with no window towards the tracks with one tv that doesn't work. And still don't expect to display the correct hour anyway.

Better take bus than this dirty train.
People so loud, behave despicably.
Not recommend use this company.
Strongly recommend take bus or fly.
this train was never cleaned and there were cockroaches crawling in it

Travelled overnight into Nha Trang. Be very aware of the taxi drivers, only go with the official taxis, do not go with the plain white cars, they are the pirates, try and over charge, say they have a meter, it's not true. If the are approaching you and talking quickly walk away. Beware people. The first class sleeper is  rustic and you could be sharing the cab with 3 others. The station itself has probably seen better days and taking the leap of faith off the platform to cross the tracks is different. We did see the ramp as we got closer to the exit.

We arrived late night from Quy Nhon. There were many taxi drivers approaching while we arrived, but we just passed them and ordered a Grab. grab was around 30k to the beach area for the hotels. All pretty quick.

data.formatted_address: Vĩnh Trung, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Central Bus Station Nha Trang

reviews.text: I got dropped off here coming from Dalat and there was a free van here to send the passengers to the city center.

Bought bus tickets at our hotel, from Nha Trang to Dalat. Great to know, there was free pick up, from our hotel to the bus station. A clean and a small bus station. Asked for instruction from the ticketing staff and despite little English spoken, she directed us to where we should wait for our bus. Great and kind lady!!!
And finally, a clean bus to board into!!!

If you want to go to the centre of nha trang, take taxi. Never let a young guy take your luggage cuz he is a liar. He brought two of us to his van and cost you more than 250,000 vnd per person and did not dropp us off the place we wanted to go.

We arrived on the Futa bus from Da Lat. We knew our ticket included a free drop off van ride to our hotel. The taxi drivers crowded the exit of the bus, making it hard to move as they repeatedly shouted "Taxi" and we responded No we're taking the drop off van from Futa we paid for! We informed several other bus riders that their ticket includes free drop off, and they thanked us because they were about to pay for a taxi. We asked the assistant bus driver where to go to wait for the free gray van to our hotel and he said to take a taxi because there's no free van! Taxi drivers bombarded us when he said that. We knew that wasn't right, so we broke thru the crowd of taxi drivers and all went where the Vietnamese people were waiting. Sure enough, friendly Futa employees asked us what hotel we we're getting dropped off at and got us all on the free van. Futa should ensure they inform their customers they get a free drop off. Maybe have an English language sign on the bus by the seat chart. This kind of behavior by the Futa assistant bus driver and the Taxi drivers will continue to leave tourists with a bad impression of Futa and Vietnam. I hope Futa fixes this.

The process was otherwise good. Ticket purchase was easy and friendly enough. Bus ride felt safer than the ride to Da Lat with a different company.  Sleeper beds were comfy for the 4 hours. Air conditioning worked well. They gave a free bottle of water. There was a stop for 20 minutes to use the bathroom and eat. I was going to leave a positive review until the Taxi experience.

We took the free shuttle bus provided by Futa Bus to the central bus station, awaiting at 7:30am in the hotel, the driver came at 8am, we finally arrived the bus station at 8:50am.

If I took Grab, it would just took me about 15mins to get there. :(

I strong recommend to take taxi / grab to get here!
