reviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Xom Moi Garden in Da Nang, Vietnam, and it was an experience I won't soon forget. From the moment I stepped into the restaurant, I was greeted with warm smiles and a serene atmosphere that immediately put me at ease.

The restaurant itself is beautifully designed, with a mix of traditional Vietnamese architecture and modern touches that create a unique and inviting space. The outdoor seating area is particularly charming, with lush greenery and comfortable seating that make it the perfect place to enjoy a meal on a warm evening.

But the real star of the show at Xom Moi Garden is the food. The menu is a celebration of Vietnamese cuisine, with a focus on fresh, locally sourced ingredients that are expertly prepared and presented. Every bite was a delight, and I savored each one as I soaked in the tranquil ambiance of the restaurant.

The staff was attentive and friendly, and they went out of their way to ensure that my dining experience was nothing short of perfect.

If you find yourself in Da Nang, I highly recommend making a reservation at Xom Moi Garden. You won't be disappointed!

Every delicious and captain can speak fluent English! Highly recommend morning glory with razor clams and seafood fried rice. Fried rice is with coconut taste and good to eat with a bit soy sauce provided. Rib tip is delicious and cheap too. Perfect match with beer!

I think you're the boss of Korea, but it's hard to do business like this.
I didn't go to many families and eat cheap food, but honestly, it's not cost-effective.
There were so many parts that I couldn't eat because the meat was tough.
It's the worst cost-effective.
I don't want to be fooled by five stars.

This is a busy restaurant with people waiting for tables on the second floor of the building.  I arrived just before the lunch-rush and ordered the pho.  When it arrived it did not have the usual accompaniments; as well as the chilis were replaced with bottled sauce! I requested fresh and was given a small serving. The pho  was barely warm and it had a 'funny' aftertaste. There were barely any noodles in the bowl and the beef was very fatty and chewy.  The service was quick and pleasant. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing but I will not return.  Too busy and I wasn't impressed at all.
Great customer service, nice atmosphere, and the food was nothing special but I loved how they made Banh Xeo on the table for you.

reviews.text:
The equipment is professional, using Petzl harnesses and clips. They also provided a crash course on how to clip and unclip from the safety line, ensuring at least 1 clip on at all times.
•
The entire canopy tour lasts about 90-120 minutes, depending on traversal speed.
•
The instructors are highly professional, providing reassurance on course navigation and ensuring our safety.
•
They also serve as photographers and videographers. 🤣
•
After the course, we were taken to a dining hut where we were served fried fish fillet and simple fried rice.
•
There's a scheduled time for ferrying everyone back, considering ATV and rafting tours with different end times.
the view is okay but having a moment with nature is good. Very friendly guide, good lunch food. recommend you try it once

Nice place and good service of ATV bike. The staffs are friendly. We did not make a booking before so that had taken more than 4 hours to wait our turn but it’s okie, we had good lunch with drilled chicken there

Brilliant! This place is an amazing place the view here was amazing it has alot of fun activitys like zipline atv trekking and camping. The service here was excellent, personally I went for a ziplining trip with my son the ziplining service has two category of 1 and 2 hours. In conclusion I recomend this place esspecially for thrill seekers.Rest assured for amazing service and super photos.

Super nice coach and amazing experience!
We came on a weekday, we’re the only one visiting that day. Our coach Stephen/Steven and his partner (sorry I didn’t catch his name) were super friendly and helpful. Besides giving us detailed safety checks, they also made jokes and friendly pranks from time to time!
Personally I think the route is suitable for teenagers or above, some spots are a bit challenging to go. But rest assured, the coaches are always here to monitor to make sure we’re safe and won’t fall too behind.
They will take photos and videos along the ride for you as well, not once they drop my phone haha. Good memories recorded!
The location is a bit hard to reach, which took around an hour from Nha Trang downtown, better communicate with the driver on return trip.
They also have other activities available, they all look super fun but sadly we didn’t plan enough time for this:(
Overall a very good experience, recommended for adventurous travellers.

reviews.text: This gallery is lovely; I really enjoyed the beautiful pictures on display. The photographer has incredible talent. When I visited, the photographer was also there, he is very friendly. I highly recommend visiting this gallery if you appreciate art and photography like I do.

Out of respect for the artist I have refrained from posting one or two photos I took of his most evocative photos. He came, almost running toward me arms crossed, somewhat angrily saying, “No, no. No photos!” Perhaps he’s gotten sick of people visiting, shooting photos of his work and leaving without purchasing anything. I tried engaging him in conversation, complimenting his work and asking if he knew a couple of other photographers whose work I admire here in Vietnam. Perhaps that was the wrong topic to introduce. In any case he seemed disinterested in me and my interest in his work. I’ll take personal responsibility for that and try to find a better way to connect next time. His work is, indeed interesting and technically quite good. It was hard to discern, however, how much he might have connected with his subjects on a personal level. I’d be curious to know more about that.

Really great work. Some heart touching pictures. There was a picture of a rainy street so evocative that I imagined that I heard it raining! Worth a visit. Hope Mr Long Thanh makes his work available in accessible merchandise like Postcards, T-Shirts etc too
Very impressed by Mr Thanh talent. I like the atmosphere of the gallery. Just sit and have a drink and chit chat with the artist is already a pleasure.
Great to have discovered Long Thanh’s gallery in downtown Nah Trang. It was very special to have visited his gallery in his own hometown.

data.formatted_address: 01 Thái Nguyên, Phước Tân, Nha Trang, Khánh Hòa 650000, Vietnam
data.name: Nhà thờ Núi

reviews.text:
Gothic-style church popular with tourists. Clean and well-maintained. Church staff are at the gate with a conspicuous donation box collecting entry fee/donations. Contrary to other reviewer's experience, they just stood there and didn't create any trouble when I dropped 6k in.

Church compound is great for a few pictures and to take in the view of Nha Trang. Can complete in 20 minutes

Returning to this spot on my Nha Trang trip brought back wonderful memories. I had visited this church a few years ago and was captivated by its serene ambiance and beautiful architecture.

The statues depicting Jesus' journey, along with his companions carrying the giant cross, added a profound touch. Inside, the church is impeccably maintained, featuring comfortable benches, and the guests exuded politeness and respect. It's heartening to witness such a place.

Though I refrained from taking too many pictures during my visit on Tet holiday due to the bustling atmosphere, it remains a charming place. I highly recommend visiting if you get the chance to explore Nha Trang.

I arrived at 3:45, but the security guard at the entrance wouldn't let me in. Even though other foreigners kept coming besides us, he also stopped them. I tried showing him the clock and telling him it wasn't time to close yet, but it was no use. Not only us but everyone else took a taxi, but it was in vain. It says that entry is allowed between 2:00 and 4:15 p.m. So when is the actual entry time? I was sad that I couldn't go back and sat outside, but I saw quite a few people outside not being able to go in. Maybe they and I didn't see the sign. I won't have to go again, but I don't want other people who come in the future to be in vain. How many minutes before the entrance time can visitors enter? In a visible location, clearly inform visitors of your actual opening times. It would have been better to have been able to go in and see the inside, but even though I stayed outside for a while, I could see that it was a wonderful and pious place.

Very beautiful church with love for details. You can visit it and admire it for just a little donation, it’s more than fair! Well worth a visit I recommend to you if you love god and aesthetics. It’s build with heart and soul and you can see it.

⭐️Vietnam's "Cathedral Museum," The "God" Turns Out to Be Him
✅"Three feet above is the divine, three feet below is the 'gatekeeper.' In Nha Trang, Vietnam, this grand cathedral has an interesting quirk. Upon entering, you encounter a donation box, which globally means a container to receive voluntary donations. However, the gatekeeper at the entrance demands 10,000 VND for entry. Google Maps reviews are flooded with complaints about this 'gatekeeper' extorting entry fees. In Vietnam, while you can report forced charges to the police, who would waste their time for about 0.5 USD? I obediently paid the 'ticket' fee, hoping to complain to the church staff or priest, only to find that the gatekeeper speaks the best English in the entire cathedral. So how can a mere complaint resolve this? Why not just boldly rename the church to 'Nha Trang Cathedral Museum'?

✅My visit to Nha Trang Cathedral was fraught with difficulties. On the first day, I arrived on a Sunday and was told by the gatekeeper that entry was at 10:00 due to worship. I visited another site and returned at around 12:00, only to find that it reopened at 14:00. Maps indicated that the cathedral has a daily lunch break. So, is it the 'divine' resting or the gatekeeper needing a nap?

✅The next day, I returned dressed in a tank top and long pants, but was stopped again, being told I needed to cover my shoulders and arms. I went back to the hotel for a shawl and returned, only to face the gatekeeper's grin and the forced ticket fee situation. There seems to be no 'divine,' only the gatekeeper exercising his supreme power, indulging and enjoying it.
